showScoreExcerpt:
"Ms. McTeer and Mr. Schreiber come across as magnificent bulls who have strayed into a Limoges china shop...Directed by Josie Rourke, this latest 'Liaisons' falls into the trap of such broadness early and lies there, gesticulating madly, for more than two and a half hours. Occasionally something like real feeling raises its startled head â€” especially in the second act, when Valmont falls in love despite himself. But such twinges of emotion are more disruptive than illuminating."
